clinical_study.brief_title: Supportive Periodontal Therapy Under Antiresorptive Therapy - a Case-Control-Study
clinical_study.official_title: Supportive Periodontal Therapy Under Antiresorptive Therapy - a Case-Control-Study

brief_summary.textblock: This case-control study investigates the course of clinical periodontal parameters during supportive periodontal therapy in patients under and without antiresorptive medication.

primary_outcome.measure: Is there a difference in the clinical attachmentlevel between baseline and 12 months after the beginning of supportive periodontal therapy in patients under antiresorptive therapy compared to patients without antiresorptive medication?

secondary_outcome.measure: Is Intraoral digital photography suitable for DMFT and implants assessment?

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing supportive periodontal therapy and independently antiresorptive therapy.
Patients undergoing supportive periodontal therapy without the need for antiresorptive therapy.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing supportive periodontal therapy (SPT) in the Section of Periodontology, Clinic of Conservative Dentistry, University Hospital Heidelberg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing supportive periodontal therapy (SPT) after completing anti-infectious therapy (AIT) in the Section of Periodontology, Clinic of Conservative Dentistry, University Hospital Heidelberg
- Regular attendance to SPT (no interruption of interval of more than one year)
- Existing radiographs (orthopantomogram or dental status) of up to six months before AIT
- Test group: patients on antiresorptive medication (underlying diseases: osteoporosis, cancer diseases)
- Understanding of participation in this study and given informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients < 18 years
- Patients who underwent radiation therapy
- Pregnancy
